info.title: CDR Energy Standards - DRAFT
info.description: Consumer Data Right end points and payloads for the Energy sector

servicePointId.description: Tokenised ID of the service point to be used for referring to the service point in the CDR API suite.  To be created in accordance with CDR ID permanence requirements

approvedCapacity.description: Approved small generating unit capacity as agreed with NSP in the connection agreement, expressed in kVA

availablePhasesCount.description: The number of phases available for the installation of DER

installedPhasesCount.description: The number of phases that DER is installed on

islandableInstallation.description: For identification of small generating units designed with the ability to operate in an islanded mode

hasCentralProtectionControl.description: For DER installations where NSPs specify the need for additional forms of protection above those inbuilt in an inverter.  If absent then assumed to be false

protectionMode.description: Required only when the hasCentralProtectionAndControl flag is set to true

exportLimitkva.description: Maximum amount of power (kVA) that may be exported from a connection point to the grid, as monitored by a control / relay function. A null value indicates no limit

underFrequencyProtection.description: Protective function limit. Default value 47 Hz according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

underFrequencyProtectionDelay.description: Trip delay time in seconds. Default value 2 seconds according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

overFrequencyProtection.description: Protective function limit. Default value 52 Hz according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

overFrequencyProtectionDelay.description: Trip delay time in seconds. Default value 2 seconds according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

underVoltageProtection.description: Protective function limit. Default value 180V according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

underVoltageProtectionDelay.description: Trip delay time in seconds. Default value 2 seconds according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

overVoltageProtection.description: Protective function limit. Default value 260 V according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

overVoltageProtectionDelay.description: Trip delay time in seconds. Default value 2 seconds according to AS4777-1: 2016 Table 2

frequencyRateOfChange.description: Rate of change of frequency trip point (Hz/s)

interTripScheme.description: Description of the form of inter-trip (e.g. 'from local substation')

connectionIdentifier.description: AC Connection ID as defined in the DER register.  Does not align with CDR ID permanence standards

count.description: Number of AC Connections in the group. For the suite of AC Connections to be considered as a group, all of the AC Connections included must have the same attributes

equipmentType.description: Indicates whether the DER device is connected via an inverter (and what category of inverter it is) or not (e.g. rotating machine)

manufacturerName.description: The name of the inverter manufacturer

commissioningDate.description: The date that the DER installation is commissioned

status.description: Code used to indicate the status of the Inverter. This will be used to identify if an inverter is active or inactive or decommissioned

inverterDeviceCapacity.description: The rated AC output power that is listed in the product specified by the manufacturer

count.description: Number of devices in the group of DER devices

manufacturer.description: The name of the device manufacturer

modelNumber.description: The model number of the device

status.description: Code used to indicate the status of the device. This will be used to identify if an inverter is active or inactive or decommissioned

installationStage.description: Description of the device installation stage

type.description: Used to indicate the primary technology used in the DER device

subtype.description: This field is also used to record for example the battery chemistry, or the type of PV panel. It is also used to record if a battery is contained in an electric vehicle connected in a vehicle-to-grid arrangement

nominalRatedCapacity.description: Maximum output in kVA that is listed in the product specification by the manufacturer. This refers to the capacity of each unit within the device group

nominalStorageCapacity.description: Maximum storage capacity in kVAh. This refers to the capacity of each storage module within the device group

self.description: Fully qualified link that generated the current response document
Fully qualified link that generated the current response document

first.description: URI to the first page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

prev.description: URI to the previous page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

next.description: URI to the next page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

last.description: URI to the last page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

servicePointId.name: servicePointId
servicePointId.description: ID of the specific service point requested.  This is a tokenised ID previous obtained from the Service Point List Data end point.  Note that it is not a nationalMeteringId.

accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: ID of a specific account to obtain data for.  This is a tokenised ID previous obtained from the Account List end point.

newest-time.name: newest-time
newest-time.description: Constrain the request to records with effective time at or before this date/time.  If absent defaults to current date/time.  Format is aligned to DateTimeString common type

oldest-time.name: oldest-time
oldest-time.description: Constrain the request to records with effective time at or after this date/time. If absent defaults to newest-time minus 12 months.  Format is aligned to DateTimeString common type

newest-date.name: newest-date
newest-date.description: Constrain the request to records with effective date at or before this date.  If absent defaults to current date.  Format is aligned to DateString common type

oldest-date.name: oldest-date
oldest-date.description: Constrain the request to records with effective date at or after this date. If absent defaults to newest-date minus 24 months days.  Format is aligned to DateString common type

page.name: page
page.description: Page of results to request (standard pagination)

page-size.name: page-size
page-size.description: Page size to request.  Default is 25 (standard pagination)

x-v.name: x-v
x-v.description: Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If the value of [x-min-v](#request-headers) is equal to or higher than the value of [x-v](#request-headers) then the [x-min-v](#request-headers) header should be treated as absent. If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable. See [HTTP Headers](#request-headers)

x-min-v.name: x-min-v
x-min-v.description: Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable.

x-fapi-interaction-id.name: x-fapi-interaction-id
x-fapi-interaction-id.description: An [RFC4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) UUID used as a correlation id. If provided, the data holder must play back this value in the x-fapi-interaction-id response header. If not provided a [RFC4122] UUID value is required to be provided in the response header to track the interaction.

x-fapi-auth-date.name: x-fapi-auth-date
x-fapi-auth-date.description: The time when the customer last logged in to the data recipient. Required for all resource calls (customer present and unattended). Not to be included for unauthenticated calls.

x-fapi-customer-ip-address.name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
x-fapi-customer-ip-address.description: The customer's original IP address if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient. The presence of this header indicates that the API is being called in a customer present context. Not to be included for unauthenticated calls.

x-cds-client-headers.name: x-cds-client-headers
x-cds-client-headers.description: The customer's original standard http headers [Base64](#common-field-types) encoded, including the original User Agent header, if the customer is currently logged in to the data recipient. Mandatory for customer present calls.  Not required for unattended or unauthenticated calls.

servicePointIdList.description: Request payload containing list of specific Service Points to obtain data for

servicePointIds.description: Array of specific servicePointIds to obtain data for

accountIdList.description: Request payload containing list of specific Accounts to obtain data for

accountIds.description: Array of specific accountIds to obtain data for

planId.description: The ID of the specific plan

effectiveFrom.description: The date and time from which this plan is effective (ie. is available for origination). Used to enable the articulation of products to the regime before they are available for customers to originate

effectiveTo.description: The date and time at which this plan will be retired and will no longer be offered. Used to enable the managed deprecation of plans

lastUpdated.description: The last date and time that the information for this plan was changed (or the creation date for the plan if it has never been altered)

displayName.description: The display name of the plan

fuelType.description: The fuel types covered by the plan

brand.description: The ID of the brand under which this plan is offered

brandName.description: The display name of the brand under which this plan is offered

thirdPartyAgentId.description: The ID of the Third Party through which this plan may be originated

thirdPartyAgentName.description: The display name of the Third Party through which this plan may be originated

applicationUri.description: A link to an application web page where this plan can be applied for

additionalInformation.description: Object that contains links to additional information on specific topics

overviewUri.description: A link to a general overview of the plan

termsUri.description: A link to terms and conditions for the plan

eligibilityUri.description: A link to detail on eligibility criteria for the plan

pricingUri.description: A link to detail on pricing for the plan

bundleUri.description: A link to detail on bundles that this plan can be a part of

customerType.description: The type of customer that the plan is offered to.  If absent then the plan is available to all customers

geography.description: Describes the geographical area that the plan is available for.  If absent then it is assumed the plan is not geographically limited

excludedPostcodes.description: Array of valid Australian post codes that are specifically excluded from the plan

includedPostcodes.description: Array of valid Australian post codes that are included from the plan.  If absent defaults to all non-excluded post codes

supplyAreas.description: Array of supply areas for which this plan is available

displayName.description: Display name of the supply area

distributor.description: The name of the distributor for the supply area

state.description: The Australian state that the plan is applicable to.  Valid values are defined by Australia Post PAF code file State Type Abbreviation. For example: NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

planId.description: The ID of the specific plan

effectiveFrom.description: The date and time from which this plan is effective (ie. is available for origination). Used to enable the articulation of products to the regime before they are available for customers to originate

effectiveTo.description: The date and time at which this plan will be retired and will no longer be offered. Used to enable the managed deprecation of plans

lastUpdated.description: The last date and time that the information for this plan was changed (or the creation date for the plan if it has never been altered)

displayName.description: The display name of the plan

fuelType.description: The fuel types covered by the plan

brand.description: The ID of the brand under which this plan is offered

brandName.description: The display name of the brand under which this plan is offered

thirdPartyAgentId.description: The ID of the Third Party through which this plan may be originated

thirdPartyAgentName.description: The display name of the Third Party through which this plan may be originated

applicationUri.description: A link to an application web page where this plan can be applied for

additionalInformation.description: Object that contains links to additional information on specific topics

overviewUri.description: A link to a general overview of the plan

termsUri.description: A link to terms and conditions for the plan

eligibilityUri.description: A link to detail on eligibility criteria for the plan

pricingUri.description: A link to detail on pricing for the plan

bundleUri.description: A link to detail on bundles that this plan can be a part of

customerType.description: The type of customer that the plan is offered to.  If absent then the plan is available to all customers

geography.description: Describes the geographical area that the plan is available for.  If absent then it is assumed the plan is not geographically limited

excludedPostcodes.description: Array of valid Australian post codes that are specifically excluded from the plan

includedPostcodes.description: Array of valid Australian post codes that are included from the plan.  If absent defaults to all non-excluded post codes

supplyAreas.description: Array of supply areas for which this plan is available

displayName.description: Display name of the supply area

distributor.description: The name of the distributor for the supply area

state.description: The Australian state that the plan is applicable to.  Valid values are defined by Australia Post PAF code file State Type Abbreviation. For example: NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

meteringCharges.description: Charges for metering included in the plan

displayName.description: Display name of the charge

minimumValue.description: Minimum value of the charge if the charge is a range or the absolute value of the charge if no range is specified

maximumValue.description: The upper limit of the charge if the charge could occur in a range

period.description: The charges that occur on a schedule indicates the frequency. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

gasContract.description: The details of the terms for the supply of electricity under this plan.  Is mandatory if fuelType is set to GAS or DUAL

additionalFeeInformation.description: Free text field containing additional information of the fees for this contract

pricingModel.description:
The pricing model for the contract.  Contracts for gas must use SINGLE_RATE.  Note that the detail for the enumeration values are:

* **SINGLE_RATE** - all energy usage is charged at a single unit rate no matter when it is consumed. Multiple unit rates may exist that correspond to varying volumes of usage i.e. a block or step tariff (first 50kWh @ X cents, next 50kWh at Y cents etc.
* **SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **TIME_OF_USE** - energy usage is charged at unit rates that vary dependent on time of day and day of week that the energy is consumed
* **TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **QUOTA** - all energy usage is charged at a single fixed rate, up to a specified usage quota/allowance. All excess usage beyond the allowance is then charged at a single unit rate (may not be the best way to explain it but it is essentially a subscription or telco style product i.e. $50/month for up to 150kWh included usage

termType.description: The term for the contract.  If absent assumes no specified term

timeZone.description: Required if pricingModel is set to TIME_OF_USE.  Defines the time zone to use for calculation of the time of use thresholds

benefitPeriod.description: Description of the benefit period.  Should only be present if termType has the value ONGOING

terms.description: Free text description of the terms for the contract

isFixed.description: Flag indicating whether prices are fixed or variable

variation.description: Free text description of price variation policy and conditions for the contract.  Mandatory if isFixed is true

onExpiryDescription.description: Free text field that describes what will occur on or prior to expiry of the fixed contract term or benefit period

meterTypes.description: An array of the meter types that this contract is available for

coolingOffDays.description: Number of days in the cooling off period for the contract.  Mandatory for plans with type of MARKET

billFrequency.description: An array of the available billing schedules for this contract. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

controlledLoad.description: Required if pricing model is SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD or TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD

displayName.description: A display name for the controlled load tier

description.description: A description of the controlled load tier

dailyCharge.description: The daily supply charge (exclusive of GST) for this controlled load tier

period.description: The period for which the controlled load rate applies. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

incentives.description: Optional list of incentives available for the contract

displayName.description: The display name of the incentive

discounts.description: Optional list of discounts available for the contract

displayName.description: The display name of the discount

category.description: The type of the discount.  Mandatory if the discount type is CONDITIONAL

methodUType.description: The method of calculation of the discount

rate.description: The rate of the discount applied to the bill amount (some types of charges may be excluded from this discount based on plan terms)
The rate of the discount applied to the usageamount

amount.description: The amount of the discount

rate.description: The rate of the discount over the usage amount

usageAmount.description: The usage amount threshold above which the discount applies

greenPowerCharges.description: Optional list of charges applicable to green power

displayName.description: The display name of the charge

tiers.description: Array of charge tiers based on the percentage of green power used for the period implied by the type.  Array is in order of increasing percentage of green power

percentGreen.description: The upper percentage of green power used applicable for this tier

rate.description: The rate of the charge if the type implies the application of a rate

amount.description: The amount of the charge if the type implies the application of a fixed amount

type.description: The type of the eligibility restriction

information.description: Information of the eligibility restriction specific to the type of the restriction

description.description: A description of the eligibility restriction

fee.description: An array of fees applicable to the plan

amount.description: The fee amount. Required if term is not PERCENT_OF_BILL

rate.description: The fee rate. Required if term is PERCENT_OF_BILL

solarFeedInTariff.description: Array of feed in tariffs for solar power

amount.description: The tariff amount per kWh

displayName.description: The name of the tariff period

startDate.description: The start date of the tariff period in a calendar year.  Required if there is more than one period.  Formatted in mm-dd format

endDate.description: The end date of the tariff period in a calendar year.  Required if there is more than one period.  Formatted in mm-dd format

dailySupplyCharges.description: The amount of access charge for the tariff period, in cents per day exclusive of GST.

rateBlockUType.description: Specifies the type of rate applicable to this tariff period

singleRate.description: Object representing a single rate.  Required if rateBlockUType is singleRate

displayName.description: Display name of the rate

generalUnitPrice.description: The block rate (unit price) for any usage above the included fixed usage, in cents per kWh inclusive of GST.  Only required if pricingModel field is QUOTA

period.description: Usage period for which the block rate applies. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

timeOfUseRates.description: Array of objects representing time of use rates.  Required if rateBlockUType is timeOfUseRates

displayName.description: Display name of the rate

type.description: The type of usage that the rate applies to

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

days.description: The days that the rate applies to

startTime.description: Start of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

displayName.description: Display name of the charge

amount.description: The charge amount per kWh exclusive of GST

startTime.description: Start of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

electricityContract.description: The details of the terms for the supply of electricity under this plan.  Is mandatory if fuelType is set to ELECTRICITY or DUAL

additionalFeeInformation.description: Free text field containing additional information of the fees for this contract

pricingModel.description:
The pricing model for the contract.  Contracts for gas must use SINGLE_RATE.  Note that the detail for the enumeration values are:

* **SINGLE_RATE** - all energy usage is charged at a single unit rate no matter when it is consumed. Multiple unit rates may exist that correspond to varying volumes of usage i.e. a block or step tariff (first 50kWh @ X cents, next 50kWh at Y cents etc.
* **SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **TIME_OF_USE** - energy usage is charged at unit rates that vary dependent on time of day and day of week that the energy is consumed
* **TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **QUOTA** - all energy usage is charged at a single fixed rate, up to a specified usage quota/allowance. All excess usage beyond the allowance is then charged at a single unit rate (may not be the best way to explain it but it is essentially a subscription or telco style product i.e. $50/month for up to 150kWh included usage

servicePointId.description: The ID of the service point for use in the CDR APIs.  Created according to the rules for ID permanence

nationalMeteringId.description: The independent ID of the service point, known in the industry as the NMI

servicePointClassification.description: The classification of the service point as defined in MSATS procedures

servicePointStatus.description: Code used to indicate the status of the service point

jurisdictionCode.description: Jurisdiction code to which the service point belongs.This code defines the jurisdictional rules which apply to the service point

isGenerator.description: This flag determines whether the energy at this connection point is to be treated as consumer load or as a generating unit(this may include generator auxiliary loads).If absent defaults to false

validFromDate.description: The start date from which this service point first became valid

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The date and time that the information for this service point was modified

classification.description: A code that defines the consumer class as defined in the National Energy Retail Regulations, or in overriding Jurisdictional instruments

threshold.description: A code that defines the consumption threshold as defined in the National Energy Retail Regulations, or in overriding Jurisdictional instruments

servicePointId.description: The ID of the service point for use in the CDR APIs.  Created according to the rules for ID permanence

nationalMeteringId.description: The independent ID of the service point, known in the industry as the NMI

servicePointClassification.description: The classification of the service point as defined in MSATS procedures

servicePointStatus.description: Code used to indicate the status of the service point

jurisdictionCode.description: Jurisdiction code to which the service point belongs.This code defines the jurisdictional rules which apply to the service point

isGenerator.description: This flag determines whether the energy at this connection point is to be treated as consumer load or as a generating unit(this may include generator auxiliary loads).If absent defaults to false

lastUpdateDateTime.description: The date and time that the information for this service point was modified

creationDateTime.description: The date and time that this service point was created as a data entity

classification.description: A code that defines the consumer class as defined in the National Energy Retail Regulations, or in overriding Jurisdictional instruments

threshold.description: A code that defines the consumption threshold as defined in the National Energy Retail Regulations, or in overriding Jurisdictional instruments

code.description: A code used to identify data loss factor for the service point values.  Refer to AEMO distribution loss factor documents for each financial year to interpret

description.description: Description of the data loss factor code and value

lossValue.description: The value associated with the loss factor code

party.description: An identifier of the party related to this service point

role.description: The role performed by this participant in relation to the service point

addressUType.description: The type of address object present

simple.description: The address of the service point.  Mandatory if addressUType is set to simple

mailingName.description: Name of the individual or business formatted for inclusion in an address used for physical mail

addressLine1.description: First line of the standard address object

addressLine2.description: Second line of the standard address object

addressLine3.description: Third line of the standard address object

city.description: Name of the city or locality

state.description: Free text if the country is not Australia. If country is Australia then must be one of the values defined by the [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf) in the PAF file format. NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

country.description: A valid [ISO 3166 Alpha-3](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code. Australia (AUS) is assumed if country is not present.

paf.description: The address of the service point.  Mandatory if addressUType is set to paf. Formatted according to the file format defined by the [PAF file format](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf)

dpid.description: Unique identifier for an address as defined by Australia Post.  Also known as Delivery Point Identifier

thoroughfareNumber1.description: Thoroughfare number for a property (first number in a property ranged address)

thoroughfareNumber1Suffix.description: Suffix for the thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber1 is populated

thoroughfareNumber2.description: Second thoroughfare number (only used if the property has a ranged address eg 23-25)

thoroughfareNumber2Suffix.description: Suffix for the second thoroughfare number. Only relevant is thoroughfareNumber2 is populated

flatUnitType.description: Type of flat or unit for the address

floorLevelType.description: Type of floor or level for the address

floorLevelNumber.description: Floor or level number (including alpha characters)

streetType.description: The street type. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

streetSuffix.description: The street type suffix. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

postalDeliveryType.description: Postal delivery type. (eg. PO BOX). Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file

postalDeliveryNumber.description: Postal delivery number if the address is a postal delivery type

postalDeliveryNumberPrefix.description: Postal delivery number prefix related to the postal delivery number

postalDeliveryNumberSuffix.description: Postal delivery number suffix related to the postal delivery number

state.description: State in which the address belongs. Valid enumeration defined by Australia Post PAF code file [State Type Abbreviation](https://auspost.com.au/content/dam/auspost_corp/media/documents/australia-post-data-guide.pdf). NSW, QLD, VIC, NT, WA, SA, TAS, ACT, AAT

meterId.description: The meter ID uniquely identifies a meter for a given service point.  Is unique in the context of the service point.  Is not globally unique

status.description: A code to denote the status of the meter

installationType.description: The metering Installation type code indicates whether the metering installation has to be manually read

manufacturer.description: Free text field to identify the manufacturer of the installed meter

model.description: Free text field to identify the meter manufacturers designation for the meter model

readType.description: Code to denote the method and frequency of Meter Reading

streams.description: Usage data streams available from the meter

streamId.description: Unique identifier of the stream within this service point.  Is not globally unique

averagedDailyLoad.description: The energy delivered through a connection point or metering point over an extended period normalised to a 'per day' basis (kWh)

registerConsumptionType.description: Indicates the consumption type of register

networkTariffType.description: The Network Tariff Code is a free text field containing a code supplied and published by the local network service provider

unitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure for data held in this register

timeOfDay.description: Code to identify the time validity of register contents

multiplier.description: Multiplier required to take a register value and turn it into a value representing billable energy

controlledLoad.description: Indicates whether the energy recorded by this register is created under a Controlled Load regime. ControlledLoad field will have 'No' if register does not relate to a Controlled Load.  If the register relates to a Controlled Load, it should contain a description of the Controlled Load regime.

servicePointId.description: Tokenised ID of the service point to be used for referring to the service point in the CDR API suite.  To be created in accordance with CDR ID permanence requirements

registerId.description: Register ID of the meter register where the meter reads are obtained

registerSuffix.description: Register suffix of the meter register where the meter reads are obtained

meterSerial.description: Meter serial number as it appears in customers bill

readStartDate.description: Date time when the meter reads start

readEndDate.description: Date time when the meter reads end.  If absent then assumed to be equal to readStartDate.  In this case the entry represents data for a single date specified by readStartDate

unitOfMeasure.description: Unit of measure of the meter reads. If absent then assumed to be KWH

readUType.description: Specify the type of the meter read data

basicRead.description: Mandatory if readUType is set to basicRead

quality.description: The quality of the read taken.  If absent then assumed to be ACTUAL

value.description: Meter read value.  If positive then it means consumption, if negative it means export

intervalRead.description: Mandatory if readUType is set to intervalRead

aggregateValue.description: The aggregate sum of the interval read values.  If positive then it means net consumption, if negative it means net export from the premise

intervalReads.description: Array of reads with each element indicating the read for the interval specified by readIntervalLength beginning at midnight of readStartDate

quality.description: The quality of the read taken.  If absent then assumed to be ACTUAL

value.description: Interval value.  If positive then it means consumption, if negative it means export

accountId.description: The ID of the account.  To be created in accordance with CDR ID permanence requirements

accountNumber.description: Optional identifier of the account as defined by the data holder.  This must be the value presented on physical statements (if it exists) and must not be used for the value of accountId

displayName.description: An optional display name for the account if one exists or can be derived.  The content of this field is at the discretion of the data holder

creationDate.description: The date that the account was created or opened

servicePointIds.description: An array of servicePointIds, representing NMIs, that this account is linked to

displayName.description: The name of the plan if one exists

startDate.description: The start date of the applicability of this plan

endDate.description: The end date of the applicability of this plan

accountId.description: The ID of the account.  To be created in accordance with CDR ID permanence requirements

accountNumber.description: Optional identifier of the account as defined by the data holder.  This must be the value presented on physical statements (if it exists) and must not be used for the value of accountId

displayName.description: An optional display name for the account if one exists or can be derived.  The content of this field is at the discretion of the data holder

creationDate.description: The date that the account was created or opened

servicePointIds.description: An array of servicePointIds, representing NMIs, that this account is linked to

displayName.description: The name of the plan if one exists

startDate.description: The start date of the applicability of this plan

endDate.description: The end date of the applicability of this plan

planDetail.description: Detail on the plan applicable to this account

fuelType.description: The fuel types covered by the plan

meteringCharges.description: Charges for metering included in the plan

displayName.description: Display name of the charge

minimumValue.description: Minimum value of the charge if the charge is a range or the absolute value of the charge if no range is specified

maximumValue.description: The upper limit of the charge if the charge could occur in a range

period.description: The charges that occur on a schedule indicates the frequency. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

gasContract.description: The details of the terms for the supply of electricity under this plan.  Is mandatory if fuelType is set to GAS or DUAL

additionalFeeInformation.description: Free text field containing additional information of the fees for this contract

pricingModel.description:
The pricing model for the contract.  Contracts for gas must use SINGLE_RATE.  Note that the detail for the enumeration values are:

* **SINGLE_RATE** - all energy usage is charged at a single unit rate no matter when it is consumed. Multiple unit rates may exist that correspond to varying volumes of usage i.e. a block or step tariff (first 50kWh @ X cents, next 50kWh at Y cents etc.
* **SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **TIME_OF_USE** - energy usage is charged at unit rates that vary dependent on time of day and day of week that the energy is consumed
* **TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **QUOTA** - all energy usage is charged at a single fixed rate, up to a specified usage quota/allowance. All excess usage beyond the allowance is then charged at a single unit rate (may not be the best way to explain it but it is essentially a subscription or telco style product i.e. $50/month for up to 150kWh included usage

timeZone.description: Required if pricingModel is set to TIME_OF_USE.  Defines the time zone to use for calculation of the time of use thresholds

isFixed.description: Flag indicating whether prices are fixed or variable

controlledLoad.description: Required if pricing model is SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD or TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD

displayName.description: A display name for the controlled load tier

description.description: A description of the controlled load tier

dailyCharge.description: The daily supply charge (exclusive of GST) for this controlled load tier

period.description: The period for which the controlled load rate applies. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

discounts.description: Optional list of discounts available for the contract

displayName.description: The display name of the discount

category.description: The type of the discount.  Mandatory if the discount type is CONDITIONAL

methodUType.description: The method of calculation of the discount

rate.description: The rate of the discount applied to the bill amount (some types of charges may be excluded from this discount based on plan terms)
The rate of the discount applied to the usageamount

amount.description: The amount of the discount

rate.description: The rate of the discount over the usage amount

usageAmount.description: The usage amount threshold above which the discount applies

greenPowerCharges.description: Optional list of charges applicable to green power

displayName.description: The display name of the charge

tiers.description: Array of charge tiers based on the percentage of green power used for the period implied by the type.  Array is in order of increasing percentage of green power

percentGreen.description: The upper percentage of green power used applicable for this tier

rate.description: The rate of the charge if the type implies the application of a rate

amount.description: The amount of the charge if the type implies the application of a fixed amount

fee.description: An array of fees applicable to the plan

amount.description: The fee amount. Required if term is not PERCENT_OF_BILL

rate.description: The fee rate. Required if term is PERCENT_OF_BILL

solarFeedInTariff.description: Array of feed in tariffs for solar power

amount.description: The tariff amount per kWh

displayName.description: The name of the tariff period

startDate.description: The start date of the tariff period in a calendar year.  Required if there is more than one period.  Formatted in mm-dd format

endDate.description: The end date of the tariff period in a calendar year.  Required if there is more than one period.  Formatted in mm-dd format

dailySupplyCharges.description: The amount of access charge for the tariff period, in cents per day exclusive of GST.

rateBlockUType.description: Specifies the type of rate applicable to this tariff period

singleRate.description: Object representing a single rate.  Required if rateBlockUType is singleRate

displayName.description: Display name of the rate

generalUnitPrice.description: The block rate (unit price) for any usage above the included fixed usage, in cents per kWh inclusive of GST.  Only required if pricingModel field is QUOTA

period.description: Usage period for which the block rate applies. Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

timeOfUseRates.description: Array of objects representing time of use rates.  Required if rateBlockUType is timeOfUseRates

displayName.description: Display name of the rate

type.description: The type of usage that the rate applies to

rates.description: Array of controlled load rates in order of usage volume

unitPrice.description: Unit price of usage per kWh (exclusive of GST)

volume.description: Volume in kWh that this rate applies to.  Only applicable for stepped rates where different rates apply for different volumes of usage in a period

days.description: The days that the rate applies to

startTime.description: Start of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

displayName.description: Display name of the charge

amount.description: The charge amount per kWh exclusive of GST

startTime.description: Start of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

electricityContract.description: The details of the terms for the supply of electricity under this plan.  Is mandatory if fuelType is set to GAS or DUAL

additionalFeeInformation.description: Free text field containing additional information of the fees for this contract

pricingModel.description:
The pricing model for the contract.  Contracts for gas must use SINGLE_RATE.  Note that the detail for the enumeration values are:

* **SINGLE_RATE** - all energy usage is charged at a single unit rate no matter when it is consumed. Multiple unit rates may exist that correspond to varying volumes of usage i.e. a block or step tariff (first 50kWh @ X cents, next 50kWh at Y cents etc.
* **SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **TIME_OF_USE** - energy usage is charged at unit rates that vary dependent on time of day and day of week that the energy is consumed
* **TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD** - as above, but with an additional, separate unit rate charged for all energy usage from a controlled load i.e. separately metered appliance like hot water service, pool pump etc.
* **QUOTA** - all energy usage is charged at a single fixed rate, up to a specified usage quota/allowance. All excess usage beyond the allowance is then charged at a single unit rate (may not be the best way to explain it but it is essentially a subscription or telco style product i.e. $50/month for up to 150kWh included usage

controlledLoad.description: Required if pricing model is SINGLE_RATE_CONT_LOAD or TIME_OF_USE_CONT_LOAD

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

startTime.description: Start of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

endTime.description: End of the period in HHMM format using 24 hour clock format

authorisedContacts.description: An array of additional contacts that are authorised to act on this account

firstName.description: For people with single names this field need not be present. The single name should be in the lastName field

lastName.description: For people with single names the single name should be in this field

middleNames.description: Field is mandatory but array may be empty

prefix.description: Also known as title or salutation. The prefix to the name (e.g. Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Sir, etc)

suffix.description: Used for a trailing suffix to the name (e.g. Jr)

amount.description: Optional payment amount indicating that a constant payment amount is scheduled to be paid (used in bill smooting scenarios)

paymentScheduleUType.description: The type of object present in this response

cardDebit.description: Represents a regular credit card payment schedule. Mandatory if paymentScheduleUType is set to cardDebit

cardScheme.description: The type of credit card held on file

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency that payments will occur.  Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

calculationType.description: The mechanism by which the payment amount is calculated

directDebit.description: Represents a regular direct debit from a specified bank account. Mandatory if paymentScheduleUType is set to directDebit

isTokenised.description: Flag indicating that the account details are tokenised and cannot be shared.  False if absent.  If false then bsb and accountNumber should not be expected to be included

bsb.description: The unmasked BSB for the account to be debited. Is expected to be formatted as digits only with leading zeros included and no punctuation or spaces.  Is required if isTokenised is absent or false

accountNumber.description: The unmasked account number for the account to be debited. Is expected to be formatted as digits only with leading zeros included and no punctuation or spaces.  Is required if isTokenised is absent or false

paymentFrequency.description: The frequency that payments will occur.  Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

calculationType.description: The mechanism by which the payment amount is calculated

manualPayment.description: Represents a manual payment schedule where the customer pays in response to a delivered statement. Mandatory if paymentScheduleUType is set to manualPayment

billFrequency.description: The frequency with which a bill will be issued.  Formatted according to ISO 8601 Durations (excludes recurrence syntax)

concessions.description: Array may be empty if no concessions exist

displayName.description: The display name of the concession

additionalInfo.description: Display text providing more information on the concession

additionalInfoUri.description: Optional link to additional information regarding the concession

startDate.description: Optional start date for the application of the concession

endDate.description: Optional end date for the application of the concession

dailyDiscount.description: Daily discount value due to the concession.  At least one dailyDiscount, monthlyDiscount, yearlyDiscount and percentageDiscount must be provided

monthlyDiscount.description: Monthly discount value due to the concession.  At least one dailyDiscount, monthlyDiscount, yearlyDiscount and percentageDiscount must be provided

yearlyDiscount.description: Annual discount value due to the concession.  At least one dailyDiscount, monthlyDiscount, yearlyDiscount and percentageDiscount must be provided

percentageDiscount.description: Percentage of each invoice to be discounted due to the concession.  At least one dailyDiscount, monthlyDiscount, yearlyDiscount and percentageDiscount must be provided

balance.description: The current balance of the account.  A positive value indicates that amount is owing to be paid.  A negative value indicates that the account is in credit
The current balance of the account.  A positive value indicates that amount is owing to be paid.  A negative value indicates that the account is in credit

invoices.description: Array of invoices sorted by date in descending order

accountId.description: The ID of the account for which the invoice was issued

invoiceNumber.description: The number assigned to this invoice by the energy Retailer

issueDate.description: The date that the invoice was actually issued (as opposed to generated or calculated)

dueDate.description: The date that the invoice is due to be paid

period.description: Object containing the start and end date for the period covered by the invoice

startDate.description: The start date of the period covered by this invoice

endDate.description: The end date of the period covered by this invoice

invoiceAmount.description: The net amount due for this invoice regardless of previous balance

payOnTimeDiscount.description: A discount for on time payment

amount.description: The amount that will be discounted if the invoice is paid by the date specified

date.description: The date by which the invoice must be paid to receive the pay on time discount

balanceAtIssue.description: The account balance at the time the invoice was issued

servicePoints.description: Array of service point IDs to which this invoice applies. May be empty if the invoice contains no electricity usage related charges

gas.description: Object contain charges and credits related to gas usage

totalUsageCharges.description: The aggregate total of usage charges for the period covered by the invoice

totalOnceOffCharges.description: The aggregate total of any once off charges arising from electricity usage for the period covered by the invoice

totalOnceOffDiscounts.description: The aggregate total of any once off discounts or credits arising from electricity usage for the period covered by the invoice

electricity.description: Object contain charges and credits related to electricity usage

totalUsageCharges.description: The aggregate total of usage charges for the period covered by the invoice

totalGenerationCredits.description: The aggregate total of generation credits for the period covered by the invoice

totalOnceOffCharges.description: The aggregate total of any once off charges arising from electricity usage for the period covered by the invoice

totalOnceOffDiscounts.description: The aggregate total of any once off discounts or credits arising from electricity usage for the period covered by the invoice

totalAccountCharges.description: The aggregate total of account level charges for the period covered by the invoice

totalAccountDiscounts.description: The aggregate total of account level discounts or credits for the period covered by the invoice

paymentStatus.description: Indicator of the payment status for the invoice

transactions.description: Array of transactions sorted by date and time in descending order

accountId.description: The ID of the account for which transaction applies

executionDateTime.description: The date and time that the transaction occurred

transactionUType.description: Indicator of the type of transaction object present in this record

usage.description: Represents a usage charge or generation credit.  Mandatory if transactionUType is equal to usage

servicePointId.description: The ID of the service point to which this transaction applies if any

invoiceNumber.description: The number of the invoice in which this transaction is included if it has been issued

timeOfUseType.description: The time of use type that the transaction applies to

isEstimate.description: Flag indicating if the usage is estimated or actual.  True indicates estimate.  False or absent indicates actual

startDate.description: Date and time when the usage period starts

endDate.description: Date and time when the usage period ends

usage.description: The usage for the period in kWh.  A negative value indicates power generated

amount.description: The amount charged or credited for this transaction prior to any adjustments being applied.  A negative value indicates a credit

adjustments.description: Optional array of adjustments arising for this transaction

amount.description: The amount of the adjustment

description.description: A free text description of the adjustment

onceOff.description: Represents a once off charge or credit.  Mandatory if transactionUType is equal to onceOff

servicePointId.description: The ID of the service point to which this transaction applies if any

invoiceNumber.description: The number of the invoice in which this transaction is included if it has been issued

amount.description: The amount of the charge or credit.  A positive value indicates a charge and a negative value indicates a credit

description.description: A free text description of the item

payment.description: Represents a payment to the account.  Mandatory if transactionUType is equal to payment

amount.description: The amount paid

get.description: Obtain a list of energy plans that are currently offered to the market

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Used to filter results on the type field.  Any one of the valid values for this field can be supplied plus 'ALL'.  If absent defaults to 'ALL'

parameters.name: fuelType
parameters.description: Used to filter results on the fuelType field.  Any one of the valid values for this field can be supplied plus 'ALL'.  If absent defaults to 'ALL'

parameters.name: effective
parameters.description: Allows for the filtering of plans based on whether the current time is within the period of time defined as effective by the effectiveFrom and effectiveTo fields. Valid values are CURRENT, FUTURE and ALL. If absent defaults to 'CURRENT'

parameters.name: updated-since
parameters.description: Only include plans that have been updated after the specified date and time.  If absent defaults to include all plans

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: Used to filter results on the brand field.  If absent defaults to include all plans

get.description: Obtain detailed information on a single energy plan offered openly to the market

parameters.name: planId
parameters.description: ID of the specific plan requested

get.description: Obtain a list of service points owned by the customer that has authorised the current session
Obtain a list of service points owned by the customer that has authorised the current session
Obtain a list of electricity usage data from a particular service point
Obtain usage data for all service points associated with the customer

post.summary: Get Usage For Specific Service Points
post.description: Obtain the electricity usage data for a specific set of service points

get.description: Obtain a list of DER data from a particular service point
Obtain DER data for all service points associated with the customer

post.summary: Get DER For Specific Service Points
post.description: Obtain DER data for a specific set of service points

get.description: Obtain the list of energy accounts available under the authorised consent
Obtain detailed information for a specific energy account
Obtain the agreed payment schedule and details, if any, for a specific energy account
Obtain the details of any concessions or hardship arrangements applied to a specific energy account
Obtain the current balance for a specific account
Obtain the current balance for all accounts

post.description: Obtain the current balance for a specified set of accounts

get.description: Obtain the invoices for a specific account
Obtain the invoices for all accounts

post.description: Obtain invoices for a specified set of accounts

get.description: Obtain the billing transactions for a specific account
Obtain billing transactions for all accounts

post.description: Obtain billing for a specified set of accounts
